thread.title: Obama urges Hispanics to vote
thread.title_full: Obama urges Hispanics to vote - POLITICO

author: Eliza Collins
title: Obama urges Hispanics to vote
text:
President Barack Obama on Thursday slammed the Republican presidential candidates’ policies on Hispanics — calling for the community to show their “boos” by voting. “You’ve gotta recognize that Americas greatness doesn’t come from building walls, our greatness comes from opportunity,” said Obama, who was speaking at the Congressional Hispanic Caucus Institute’s gala.
Obama touted a long list of successes during his time in the White House but said voters will not hear about them in the debates.
“They have invented this new reality where everything was terrific back in 2008 … That was the golden era apparently, the good old days, then I came along and messed it all up,” Obama said. “Now when you listen to them you still don’t know what they’re for — except turning back the clock on the work that we’ve done together.
“There’s nowhere they want to go further backwards than on immigration,” the president said.
Audience members booed.
“In these circumstances I always say don’t boo - vote,” he said. “They can’t hear the boos but they can hear your vote.”
Obama did have kind words for one Republican — George W. Bush — praising his call for immigration reform but saying the rest of his party never followed suit.
“Think how much better our economy would be if the rest of his party got the message,” he said.
The crowd shouted so much praise for Obama that he had to tell them to stop so he could continue his speech.
“I love you too, but I gotta tell this story,” the president said before beginning a story about former Rep. Ed Roybal — who helped start the CHC — on the night he proposed to his wife but was subsequently unfairly questioned by police.
“We can imagine his fear and his humiliation, what had been a beautiful day had suddenly come an example of occurrences that were happening far too often,” Obama said.
He said the rhetoric today is “the same cruel impulse that Ed Roybal spent a lifetime fighting against.”
